title: Lenny Kravitz has a VERY flirty interview with Australian journalist
text:
He's been voted one of the 'sexiest men alive' on numerous occasions and has dated a number of very famous and glamorous women.

And American rocker Lenny Kravitz lived up to his heartthrob status, during a very flirty interview with Angela Cox on Australian current affairs program, Sunday Night.

Upon hearing that Angela was to fly back to Australia from Los Angeles in just five hours time, the 55-year-old offered her 'really good wine' in order to get 'loose'.

'Do you want a glass of good wine? I want you to be loose': Lenny Kravitz (pictured), 55, had a VERY flirty interview with an Australian journalist, ahead of his 2020 Australian tour

'How long are you staying here?' Lenny asked Angela, as the interview was about to get underway in his Los Angeles home.

'I'm flying out in about five hours,' she responded, to which Lenny remarked: 'No, you're not. What? Somebody get this woman a first class ticket back.'

'I will pay for it, it's my gift,' the American Woman singer added. 'I will pay the difference. This woman deserves a first class ticket back to Australia.'

Lenny, who once dated Nicole Kidman and Natalie Imbruglia, went on to offer Angela a glass of wine to become more relaxed.

Generous: In an interview aired on Australian news program Sunday Night on Sunday, Lenny offered Angela Cox (pictured) a glass of white wine in order to become more relaxed

'Do you want a glass of really good white [wine]?' he asked. 'I think it'd be nice. I want you to be loose, loose, loose.'

'Take your wine girl, enjoy yourself,' Lenny later added.

The interview also saw Angela quiz the four-time Grammy Award winner on what he finds sexy in a woman.

There you go, ladies: During the interview, Lenny revealed 'authenticity' to be what he finds sexiest in a woman

Lenny's Australian 2020 tour dates Tuesday March 31: Spark Arena, Auckland, New Zealand Friday April 3: Qudos Bank Arena, Sydney, Australia Monday April 6: Newcastle Entertainment Centre, Australia Wednesday April 8: Rod Laver Arena, Melbourne, Australia Friday April 10: Bluesfest, Byron Bay, Australia

'Being authentic,' he said. 'We live in a world where people in so many cases are trying to be something they're not. And being whoever you are and living an authentic life I think, is the most beautiful, sexy thing.'

Lenny, who has released 11 studio albums in his career to-date, will tour Australia and New Zealand next year, for the 30th anniversary of his debut album, Let Love Rule.

The father of Big Little Lies actress Zoë Kravitz, will perform at Spark Arena in Auckland, New Zealand, on March 31, before taking to the stage in Sydney, Newcastle, Melbourne and Byron Bay.

Tour: The father of Big Little Lies actress Zoë Kravitz, will tour Australia and New Zealand next year for the 30th anniversary of his debut album. Pictured in New Jersey in August this year

Despite branching out into acting and showing a keen interest in photography, interior design and fashion, music will always remain his focus.

'Music is the centre and always will be the centre,' Lenny told The Daily Telegraph on Sunday.

'The other things are wonderful, other mediums in which I can express myself, but music is the core, the nucleus of everything in my life. I can't breathe without music, that's how it is for me.'

Tickets to 2020 Bluesfest are on sale now, while tickets for remaining Australian show dates go on sale through Ticketek on October 24, and Ticketmaster for New Zealand.
